page.title: 07SOMERSET NAMES
page.content:
{Blackford:_}is an old English name. There was a ford there which was made black by the early settlers. {Wedmore:_}means a moor for hunting. It's name has changed from waethmor- waet-wet-wed. {Ashton:_}is a farm or estate where many ash trees grew. {Crickham:_}a crick is a church or pointed hill. A ham is an enclosed meadow. {Latcham:_}a latch is a pasture and ham means field so Latcham was probably a few houses surrounded by fields. {Cocklake:_}means head of the lake.
Several bird names are known in traditional Somerset language eg. Kestrel:blood hawk, Goldcrest: ox_eye, Green Woodpecker:rainpipe or yaffle and Whitethroat:nettlecreeper.
